params.name: bookingId
params.doc: ID of the booking to cancel.

docs.summary:
Cancels a booking.
The booking status changes to `CANCELED`.
If the booking was for an appointment, the corresponding session is
deleted from the business calendar.
If the booking was for a class or course, the participants are removed
from the class session or the course. But the course or class session
remain on the business calendar.
If the booking was for an appointment, you can pass flowControlSettings.with_refund as `true`
in case you want the canceled booking to be refunded.
You can pass a `participantNotification.message` to notify the customer of
the cancellation. You also need to pass `participantNotification.notifyParticipants`
as `true` to actually send the message.
In case you want to cancel a booking on behalf of a customer, we recommend
to pass `flowControlSettings.ignoreCancellationPolicy` as `false`. This
ensures that the cancellation is validated against the service's cancellation
policy.

params.name: bookingId
params.doc: ID of the booking to confirm.

params.name: revision
params.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the current revision must be passed when
managing the booking.

docs.summary: Confirms a booking request and changes the booking status to `CONFIRMED`.
description:
Calling this endpoint doesn't check whether a slot or schedule is still
available at this time.

You can only confirm bookings for services that require the owner's manual
approval for bookings and that have a status of `PENDING`. You can read more about
[creating a service](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/services/service/create-service).

For appointment services the slot may become unavailable, depending on the
[service's](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/services/service/service-object)
`policy.bookingApprovalPolicy.requestsAffectsAvailability`.

Calling this endpoint also changes the
[session's](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/schedules-and-sessions/session/get-session)
`participants.approvalStatus` to `APPROVED`.

You can pass a `participantNotification.message` to notify the customer of
the confirmation. You also need to pass `participantNotification.notifyParticipants`
as `true` to actually send the message.

Bookings are automatically confirmed when the
service is configured to [automatically confirm](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/services/service/create-service)
bookings and the [eCommerce order](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/checkout/create-order-from-checkout)
has been approved. The slot's or schedule's availability is checked just
before confirming the booking as part of the automatic flow.

params.name: bookingId
params.doc: ID of the booking to decline.

params.name: revision
params.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the current revision must be passed when
managing the booking.

docs.summary:
Declines a `PENDING` booking request and changes the booking status to
`DECLINED`.
Calling this endpoint also changes the
[session's](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/schedules-and-sessions/session/get-session)
`participants.approvalStatus` to `DECLINED`.
You can only decline bookings for services that require the owner's manual
approval for bookings and that have a status of `PENDING`. You can read more about
[creating a service](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/services/service/create-service).
You can pass a `participantNotification.message` to notify the customer of
the decline. You also need to pass `participantNotification.notifyParticipants`
as `true` to actually send the message.
Creates a booking.
description:
To create a booking for an appointment or a session of a class, pass the
relevant `slot` in the body of the request. You can use the
[Get Slot Availability](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/bookings/availabilitycalendar---wip/get-slot-availability)
endpoint to check the availability of the session beforehand.

To create a booking for the entire course, pass the relevant `schedule` in
the body of the request. You can use the
[Get Schedule Availability](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/bookings/availabilitycalendar---wip/get-schedule-availability)
endpoint to check the availability of the course beforehand.

Bookings are created with a status of `CREATED`. `CREATED` bookings don't
appear on the business calendar and don't affect a related schedule's
availability.

If you create a booking for an existing session, we recommend that you
only pass `slot.sessionId`. Then, any specified slot details are
calculated.

If you create a booking for a new session, we recommend to call
[Get Slot Availability](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/bookings/availabilitycalendar---wip/get-slot-availability)
first. Then, pass the retrieved `availability.slot` object in the body of
the Create Booking request.

If you create a booking for a course, we recommend that you pass only
`schedule.scheduleId` and not the entire `schedule` object. Then, all
schedule details are automatically calculated.

When creating a booking you must pass either `participantsChoices` or
`totalParticipants`. If you pass `participantsChoices`, all of the
provided choices must exist for the service. Otherwise the call returns an
`INVALID_SERVICE_CHOICES` error.

When creating a booking, you can pass a `selectedPaymentOption`. This specifies
which payment method the customer intends to use. But it's possible for
them to later use another supported payment method.

After you have created the booking, you can use the
[Wix eCommerce APIs](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/checkout/introduction)
for the [checkout](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/checkout/create-checkout)
and [order](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/checkout/create-order-from-checkout)
steps of the payment flow.

params.name: bookingId
params.doc: Id of the booking to reschedule.

params.name: slot
params.doc: Information about the new slot.

docs.summary: Reschedules a booking to a different slot or session.
description:
You can only reschedule bookings for appointments or classes, you can't
reschedule course bookings.

The old session is removed from the calendar and the new session is
added.

If you reschedule a booking for a class session the new session must be an
existing session for the same class.

You can pass a `participantNotification.message` to notify the customer of
the rescheduling. You also need to pass `participantNotification.notifyParticipants`
as `true` to actually send the message.

In case the service has
[variants](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/service-options-and-variants/introduction),
you can call this endpoint to update the booking's `totalParticipants` or `participantsChoices`. If you
provide `participantsChoices`, all of the provided choices must exist for
the service. Otherwise the call returns an `INVALID_SERVICE_CHOICES` error.
If you omit `participantsChoices` in the request, the existing choices are
kept and not replaced with an empty object.

<!-- INTERNAL PERMISSION COMMENT:
You need to have the `BOOKINGS.NUMBER_OF_PARTICIPANTS_UPDATE` permission
to reschedule bookings including `participantsInfo`.
<!--END: INTERNAL PERMISSION COMMENT-->

In case you want to reschedule a booking on behalf of a customer, we recommend
to pass `flowControlSettings.ignoreReschedulePolicy` as `false`. This
ensures that the rescheduling is validated against the service's rescheduling
policy.

params.name: bookingId
params.doc: ID of the booking to update the number of participants for.

docs.summary:
Updates the number of participants for a booking.
You can only update the number of participants for class and course
bookings, you can't update it for appointment bookings.
Calling this endpoint also changes the
[session's](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/schedules-and-sessions/session/get-session)
`totalNumberOfParticipants`.
When updating the number of participants for a booking you must pass either
`participantsChoices` or `totalParticipants`. If you pass `participantsChoices`
for services that have
[variants](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/service-options-and-variants/introduction),
all of the provided choices must exist for the service. Otherwise, the
call returns an `INVALID_SERVICE_CHOICES` error.

params.name: bookingIds
params.doc: The booking id's that we want to calculate the allowedActions for

docs.summary: Calculates the allowed actions for a given list of booking id's
Creates batch of bookings

params.name: slotsBookings
params.doc: Reschedule multiple bookings to multiple slots.

params.name: bookings
params.doc: The bookings whose booked schedule is to be updated to the given schedule.

params.name: bookingId
params.doc: The booking id that we want to calculate the allowedActions for

docs.summary: Calculates the allowed actions for a given booing by id

docs.summary: Cancels a booking.
description:
The booking status changes to `CANCELED`.

If the booking was for an appointment, the corresponding session is
deleted from the business calendar.

If the booking was for a class or course, the participants are removed
from the class session or the course. But the course or class session
remain on the business calendar.

You can pass a `participantNotification.message` to notify the customer of
the cancelation. You also need to pass `participantNotification.notifyParticipants`
as `true` to actually send the message.

In case you want to cancel a booking on behalf of a customer, we recommend
to pass `flowControlSettings.ignoreCancellationPolicy` as `false`. This
ensures that the cancelation is validated against the service's cancelation
policy.

docs.summary: Confirms a booking request and changes the booking status to `CONFIRMED`.
description:
Calling this endpoint doesn't check whether a slot or schedule is still
available at this time.

You can only confirm bookings for services that require the owner's manual
approval for bookings and that have a status of `PENDING`. You can read more about
[creating a service](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/services/service/create-service).

For appointment services the slot may become unavailable, depending on the
[service's](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/services/service/service-object)
`policy.bookingApprovalPolicy.requestsAffectsAvailability`.

Calling this endpoint also changes the
[session's](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/schedules-and-sessions/session/get-session)
`participants.approvalStatus` to `APPROVED`.

You can pass a `participantNotification.message` to notify the customer of
the confirmation. You also need to pass `participantNotification.notifyParticipants`
as `true` to actually send the message.

Bookings are automatically confirmed when the
service is configured to [automatically confirm](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/services/service/create-service)
bookings and the [eCommerce order](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/checkout/create-order-from-checkout)
has been approved. The slot's or schedule's availabity is checked just
before confirming the booking as part of the automatic flow.

params.name: bookingId
params.doc: ID of the booking to be confirmed or declined.

docs.summary: If the online payment requirements were not met, nothing will happen.
description:
If money has already been transferred (non pending approval services only)
setAsConfirmed will be called
If there's double booking (according to bookings-availability)
an event will be emitted, so that a proper handling of double booking can be done


If no money was transferred
If completion of the booking will cause double booking, decline will be called
otherwise, setAsConfirmed/setAsPendingApproval will be called

SHOULD THIS BE CALLED applyPaymentUpdate? handlePaymentUpdate?

docs.summary: private API, similarly to Query, with consistent DB connection

Creates a booking.
To create a booking for an appointment or a session of a class, pass the
relevant `slot` in the body of the request. You can use the
[Get Slot Availability](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/bookings/availabilitycalendar---wip/get-slot-availability)
endpoint to check the availability of the session beforehand.
To create a booking for the entire course, pass the relevant `schedule` in
the body of the request. You can use the
[Get Schedule Availability](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/bookings/availabilitycalendar---wip/get-schedule-availability)
endpoint to check the availability of the course beforehand.
Bookings are created with a status of `CREATED`. `CREATED` bookings don't
appear on the business calendar and don't affect a related schedule's
availability.
If you create a booking for an existing session, we recommend that you
only pass `slot.sessionId`. Then, any specified slot details are
calculated.
If you create a booking for a new session, we recommend to call
[Get Slot Availability](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/bookings/availabilitycalendar---wip/get-slot-availability)
first. Then, pass the retrieved `availability.slot` object in the body of
the Create Booking request.
If you create a booking for a course, we recommend that you pass only
`schedule.scheduleId` and not the entire `schedule` object. Then, all
schedule details are automatically calculated.
When creating a booking you must pass either `participantsChoices` or
`totalParticipants`. If you pass `participantsChoices`, all of the
provided choices must exist for the service. Otherwise the call returns an
`INVALID_SERVICE_CHOICES` error.
When creating a booking, you can pass a `selectedPaymentOption`. This specifies
which payment method the customer intends to use. But it's possible for
them to later use another supported payment method.
After you have created the booking, you can use the
[Wix eCommerce APIs](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/checkout/introduction)
for the [checkout](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/checkout/create-checkout)
and [order](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/checkout/create-order-from-checkout)
steps of the payment flow.

Declines a `PENDING` booking request and changes the booking status to

description:
Calling this endpoint also changes the
[session's](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/schedules-and-sessions/session/get-session)
`participants.approvalStatus` to `DECLINED`.

You can only decline bookings for services that require the owner's manual
approval for bookings and that have a status of `PENDING`. You can read more about
[creating a service](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/services/service/create-service).

You can pass a `participantNotification.message` to notify the customer of

params.name: scheduleId
params.doc: The schedule ID for which availability is checked.

docs.summary:
Returns availability for a given schedule ID
The availability for a course is calculated by:
- Checking for total spots by the schedule's capacity
- Checking for open spots by subtracting the current number of participants from the total spots

params.name: booking
params.doc: The booking object, version 2.

params.name: _id
params.doc: Id of the booking to be rescheduled.

params.name: slot
params.doc:
The new slot to which the booking will be rescheduled
This booking will automatically be assigned to the session if given, or will create a new one if not.

docs.summary: Documented and exposed in bookings-gateway
calculates the party sizes sum  of all the bookings to a requested session_id or schedule_id

<!--ONLY:REST-->
Retrieves a list of bookings according to the provided filters and paging.
description:
<!-- Internal only
Site owner can read all the bookings created in the site.
Members can read only the bookings they created or the bookings created for them (which means: booking.contactDetails.contactId = memberId)
Visitors can read only the bookings they created or the bookings created for them (which means: booking.contactDetails.contactId = visitorId)
-->

Create a query with filters on any booking object property.
See [Query Syntax: Filters, Sorting, Fields, and Paging.](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/bookings/bookings---bookings-service/query-syntax) for the full query syntax description.

To retrieve all bookings use an empty query:
```javascript
{
"query": {}
}
```

The query runs with the following defaults:
+ skip(0)
+ limit(50)
+ descending("_createdDate")


>**Notes:**
> + Use UTC when specifying filters with dates.
> + The following objects in the `query` parameter are not supported for this query:
>    - `fields`
>    - `fieldsets`
>  - Only 1 use at a time of each filter once in the same query is supported. If a filter is defined  more than once in a query, only the first occurrence is taken.
>  - To get the available actions for a member for each booking, based on the business bookings policy, use the `withBookingAllowedActions` field.
>  - When using the queryBookings() function immediately following a change to your bookings, the data retrieved may not contain your most recent changes. See [Wix-data and Eventual Consistency](reference/wix-data/introduction#wix-data_introduction_wix-data-and-eventual-consistency) for more information.
>  - The `businessLocation.businessSchedule` object in the `bookedEntity.location` object is not supported.


> **Permissions**
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings - Including Participants permission scope.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

Reschedules a booking to a different slot or session.
You can only reschedule bookings for appointments or classes, you can't

The old session is removed from the calendar and the new session is

If you reschedule a booking for a class session the new session must be an

You can pass a `participantNotification.message` to notify the customer of

In case the service has

you can call this endpoint to update the booking's `totalParticipants` or `participantsChoices`. If you
provide `participantsChoices`, all of the provided choices must exist for

If you omit `participantsChoices` in the request, the existing choices are

to reschedule bookings including `participantsInfo`.
<!--END: INTERNAL PERMISSION COMMENT-->
In case you want to reschedule a booking on behalf of a customer, we recommend
to pass `flowControlSettings.ignoreReschedulePolicy` as `false`. This
ensures that the rescheduling is validated against the service's rescheduling
policy.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, and Floor.

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: country
members.doc: Country code.

members.name: countryFullname
members.doc: Country full name.

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the full address of this location.

members.name: geocode
members.doc: Coordinates of the physical address.

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text to help find the address.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Zip/postal code.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name, number and apartment number.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Subdivision. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: subdivisions
members.doc: Multi-level subdivisions from top to bottom.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Address latitude.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Address longitude.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name, number and apartment number.

members.name: cancel
members.doc: Is cancel booking allowed

members.name: reschedule
members.doc: Is reschedule booking allowed

description: Possible allowed actions for a Booking

members.name: schedule
members.doc: The booked schedule. The booking is automatically be assigned to the schedule's sessions.

members.name: slot
members.doc: The booked slot, which once booked becomes a session. The booking is automatically assigned to the session if given, or a session is be created if one does'nt already exist.

members.name: tags
members.doc:
List of tags for the booking.
System-assigned tags for sessions and schedules are:
+ "INDIVIDUAL" Appointments, including appointments with more than 1 participant.
+ "GROUP" Individual classes.
+ "COURSE" Courses.

members.name: title
members.doc: Session title at the time of booking.

members.name: schedule
members.doc: The booked schedule. The booking is automatically be assigned to the schedule's sessions.

members.name: slot
members.doc: The booked slot, which once booked becomes a session. The booking is automatically assigned to the session if given, or a session is be created if one does'nt already exist.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Booked resource ID.

members.name: email
members.doc: Resource's email at the time of booking.

members.name: name
members.doc: Resource's name at the time of booking.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Resources schedule ID. Read only.

members.name: firstSessionStart
members.doc: Start time of the first session. (formatted according to RFC3339). Read only.

members.name: lastSessionEnd
members.doc: End time of the last session. (formatted according to RFC3339). Read only.

members.name: location
members.doc: Location where the schedule's sessions take place. Read only.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: ID of the booked service.

members.name: timezone
members.doc: The timezone according to which the slot was shown to the user when booking, and should be shown in future.

members.name: endDate
members.doc: The end time of this Slot (formatted according to RFC3339).

members.name: location
members.doc: Location of the slot takes place.

members.name: resource
members.doc: The resource for the slot.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID. Required.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: Service ID.

members.name: sessionId
members.doc:
ID of the underlying session when session is a single session or generated from a recurring session.
If sessionId is defined in the Create Booking request, the f startDate, endDate, timezone, resource, and location fields from the request are ignored and populated from the session's information.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: The start time of this slot (formatted according to RFC3339).

members.name: timezone
members.doc: The timezone according to which the slot was shown to the user when booking, and should be shown in future.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the booking was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Booking ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the booking was updated.

members.name: additionalFields
members.doc: Additional custom fields submitted with the booking form.

members.name: bookedEntity
members.doc: An object describing the slot or schedule that was booked.

members.name: bookingSource
members.doc: An object describing the platform and application that made the booking. Read-Only.

members.name: contactDetails
members.doc: Contact details of the site visitor or member making the booking.

members.name: createdBy
members.doc:
id of the identity used to create the booking
If both Person identity and App identity are present, person identity takes precedence
only `id` is supported. contact_id and identity_type are not supported

members.name: doubleBooked
members.doc: Indicating if this booking overlaps an other existing confirmed booking

members.name: endDate
members.doc: The end date of this booking. For a slot, this is the end date of the slot. For a schedule, the end date of the last session.

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc: data extensions ExtendedFields

members.name: externalUserId
members.doc: External ID provided by the client app on creation. Read-Only.

members.name: numberOfParticipants
members.doc: Number of participants

members.name: paymentStatus
members.doc:
Payment status.
One of:
- `"NOT_PAID"` The booking is not paid for.
- `"PAID"` The booking is fully paid.
- `"PARTIALLY_PAID"` The booking is partially paid.
- `"REFUNDED"` The booking is refunded.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Revision number to be used when updating, rescheduling, or cancelling the booking. The revision number is automatically incremented when the booing is updated.

members.name: selectedPaymentOption
members.doc:
Selected payment option.
One of the payment options offered by the service, or another option if `skipSelectedPaymentOptionValidation` is `true`.
When undefined, the payment option is resolved by the service configuration on checkout. See [Create Booking](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/bookings-gateway/create-booking)

members.name: startDate
members.doc: The start date of this booking. For a slot, this is the start date of the slot. For a schedule, the start date of the first session.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Booking status.
One of:
- `"CREATED"` - The booking was created.
- `"UPDATED"` - The booking was updated.
- `"CONFIRMED"` - The booking has been confirmed and appears on the bookings calendar.
Booking can be manually confirmed using the Set As Confirmed endpoint.
Booking can be automatically confirmed when the following requirements are met:
+ The service is configured as automatically confirmed.
+ Invoking eCommerce checkout API and an order has been created.
- `"CANCELED"` - The booking has been canceled and synced to bookings calendar.
The booking can be canceled using cancel API.
- `"PENDING"` - The booking waiting to be confirmed or declined buy the owner and is synced to bookings calendar.
Bookings can be manually set as pending using setAsPending API, requires manage booking status permissions.
Booking can be automatically set as pending when the following requirements are met:
+ The Service is configured as manually confirmed.
+ Invoking the eCommerce checkout API and an order has been created.
- `"WAITING_LIST"` - The booking is pending on a waiting list.
Booking can be created with this status when invoking waiting list join API.
- `"DECLINED"` - The booking was declined by the owner and synced to bookings calendar.
Booking can be manually declined using decline API and requires manage booking permissions.
Booking can be automatically declined when the following requirements are met:
+ Invoking eCommerce checkout API and the order declined event has been sent.
+ Invoking eCommerce checkout API and order approved event has been sent, but the booking is offline and the booking causes a double booking.

members.name: canceledBy
members.doc: The identity that did the action triggered the event

members.name: currentBooking
members.doc: The canceled booking.

members.name: issueRefund
members.doc: Whether the booking should be refunded

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: currentBooking
members.doc: The booking after the changes.

members.name: previousBooking

Whether to send an SMS reminder to the customer 24 hours before the
session starts. The phone number is taken from `contactDetails.phone`.

Default: `true`.

location is set to `slot.location.formattedAddress` when provided.
Otherwise it's set to `contactDetails.fullAddress.formattedAddress`.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes,
the current revision must be passed when managing the booking.

members.name: ignoreCancellationPolicy
members.doc:
Whether the cancelation policy applies when canceling the booking. When
passing `false` you can only cancel a booking if the cancelation policy
allows it. Your app must have the `BOOKINGS.IGNORE_BOOKING_POLICY `
permission scope when passing `true`.
Default: `false`.
<!--ONLY:VELO
Requires "Manage Wix Bookings App" and "Manage Bookings' Calendar" [roles](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-overview#bookings-admin).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: withRefund
members.doc:
Whether to issue a refund when canceling the booking.
The refund will be issued only if the booking is refundable.
Currently, booking is considered refundable when it was paid by membership.
If passing `true`, the booking flow control settings will be set with refund,
otherwise, either if `false` is passed or the field remains empty,
the booking flow control settings will be set with no refund.
Default: `false`.

members.name: schedule

members.name: slot
members.doc:
Information about the slot to create a booking for.
If you set `slot.location.locationType` to `CUSTOM`, the created slot's
location is set to `slot.location.formattedAddress` when provided.
Otherwise it's set to `contactDetails.fullAddress.formattedAddress`.

members.name: skipAvailabilityValidation
members.doc:
Whether the availability is checked before creating the booking. When
passing `false` a booking is only created when the slot or schedule is
available. Your app must have the `BOOKINGS.OVERRIDE_AVAILABILITY`
permission scope when passing `true`.
Default: `false`.

members.name: skipBusinessConfirmation
members.doc:
Whether `PENDING` bookings are automatically set to `CONFIRMED` for
services that normally require the owner's manual confirmation. Your
app must have the `BOOKINGS.OVERRIDE_AVAILABILITY` permission scope
when passing `true`.
Default: `false`.

members.name: skipSelectedPaymentOptionValidation
members.doc:
Whether customers can pay using a payment method that isn't supported
for the service, but that's supported for other services. Your app
must have the `BOOKINGS.MANAGE_PAYMENTS` permission scope when passing
`true`.
Default: `false`.

members.name: booking
members.doc: Created booking.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc: ID of the form field as defined in the form.

members.doc: Form field's label at the time of submission.

members.doc:
Data Extensions extended fields
Key: Namespace
Value: extended fields data in Struct format

members.name: skipAvailabilityValidation
members.doc:
When true, skips availability checking and allows booking.
Requires BOOKINGS.OVERRIDE_AVAILABILITY permissions.

members.name: skipBusinessConfirmation
members.doc:
When true, allows booking a confirmation-required service without requiring confirmation.
Requires BOOKINGS.IGNORE_BOOKING_POLICY permissions.

members.name: skipSelectedPaymentOptionValidation
members.doc:
When true, skips selected payment option checking as defined in `selectedPaymentOption` field
and allows booking.
Requires BOOKINGS.MANAGE_PAYMENTS permissions.

members.name: withRefund
members.doc: When true, refunds the booking's payment when the booking is canceled.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: The schedule ID for which availability is checked.

members.doc: The slot for which the availability is checked.

members.doc: The timezone for which availability is to be calculated.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: _id
members.doc: Id of the booking to be rescheduled.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: slot
members.doc:
The new slot to which the booking will be rescheduled
This booking will automatically be assigned to the session if given, or will create a new one if not.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Business location ID. Available only for locations that are business locations,
meaning the `location_type` is `"OWNER_BUSINESS"`.

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: The full address of this location.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type.

- `"OWNER_BUSINESS"`: The business address, as set in the sites general settings.
- `"OWNER_CUSTOM"`: The address as set when creating the service.
- `"CUSTOM"`: The address as set for the individual session.

members.name: name
members.doc: Location name.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: serviceChoices
members.doc: Information about the booked service choices. Includes the number of participants.

members.name: message
members.doc: Custom message to send to the participants about the changes to the booking.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc:
Whether to send the message about the changes to the customer.

Default: `false`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc:
Information about whether to notify the customer about the rescheduling and
the message to send.

Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.

managing the booking.

members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.

members.name: slot
members.doc: Information about the new slot.

members.name: ignoreReschedulePolicy
members.doc:
Whether the rescheduling policy applies when rescheduling the booking.
When passing `false` you can only cancel a booking if the rescheduling
policy allows it. Your app must have the `BOOKINGS.IGNORE_BOOKING_POLICY `
permission scope when passing `true`.
Default: `false`.
<!--ONLY:VELO
Requires "Manage Wix Bookings App" and "Manage Bookings' Calendar" [roles](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-overview#bookings-admin).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: skipAvailabilityValidation
members.doc:
Whether the availability is checked before rescheduling the booking.
When passing `false` a booking is only created when the slot or
schedule is available. Your app must have the `BOOKINGS.OVERRIDE_AVAILABILITY`
permission scope when passing `true`.
Default: `false`.

members.name: skipBusinessConfirmation
members.doc:
Whether the rescheduled booking's status is automatically set to
`CONFIRMED` for services that normally require the owner's manual
confirmation. Your app must have the `BOOKINGS.OVERRIDE_AVAILABILITY`
permission scope when passing `true`.
Default: `false`.

members.name: booking
members.doc: Rescheduled booking.

members.name: bookingPolicyViolations
members.doc: Indicators of booking policy violations for the given Schedule.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Value of one of the elements of the `CustomServiceOption.choices` list

members.name: optionId
members.doc: option (.wix.api.decomposite_of) = "wix.bookings.catalog.v1.ServiceChoice";

members.name: custom
members.doc: Value of one of the elements of the `CustomServiceOption.choices` list

members.name: choices
members.doc: Service choices for these participants.

members.name: numberOfParticipants
members.doc: Number of participants for this variant.

members.name: sessionId
members.doc: The sessionId to be set.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Id of the booking to set its sessionId.

members.name: sessionId
members.doc: The sessionId to be set.

members.name: booking
members.doc: The updated booking.

members.name: endDate
members.doc:
The end time of this slot in
[RFC 3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339) format. Required.

members.name: location
members.doc: Geographic location of the slot.

members.name: resource
members.doc:
The resource required for this slot. Currently, the only supported resource
is the relevant staff member for the slot. Required.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID. Required.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: Service ID. Required.

members.name: sessionId
members.doc:
ID for the slot's corresponding session, when the session is either a single session
or a specific session generated from a recurring session. Required.

members.name: startDate
members.doc:
The start time of this slot in [RFC 3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339)
format. Required.

If `timezone` is specified,
dates are based on the local date/time. This means that the timezone offset
in the `startDate` is ignored.

members.name: timezone
members.doc:
The timezone for which slot availability is to be calculated.

If `timezone` is specified,
dates are based on the local date/time. This means that the timezone offset
in the `endDate` is ignored.

Learn more about how [timezones and daylight
savings]() are handled when
calculating availability. **TBD** DOCS to fix link.

members.name: bookable
members.doc: Whether this available sot is bookable.

members.name: bookingPolicyViolations
members.doc: Indicators for booking policy violations for the slot.

members.name: locked
members.doc: Indicates whether this slot is locked.

members.name: openSpots
members.doc: Number of open spots for this availability.

members.name: slot
members.doc: Identifier for underlying session when session is a single session or generated from a recurring session. Required.

members.name: totalSpots
members.doc:
Total number of spots for this availability.
For example, for a class of 10 spots with 3 spots booked, `spotsTotal` is 10, `openSpots` is 7.

members.name: waitingList
members.doc: An object describing the slot's waiting-list and its occupancy.

members.name: bookings
members.doc: The bookings details.

members.name: slot
members.doc:
The slot to which the bookings was rescheduled
This bookings will automatically be assigned to the session if given, or will create a new one if not.

description: Bookings to be rescheduled to the given slot.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Business Location ID. Present if the location is a business location.

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the full address of this location.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type.
One of:
- `"OWNER_BUSINESS"` The business address as set in the sites general settings.
- `"OWNER_CUSTOM"` The address as set when creating the service.
- `"CUSTOM"` The address set for the individual session.

members.name: name
members.doc: Location name.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Resource ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Resource name. Read only.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Resource ID

members.name: name
members.doc: Read only. Resource name.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

members.name: code
members.doc: Subdivision code. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: name
members.doc: Subdivision full name.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the booking was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Booking ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the booking was updated.

members.name: additionalFields
members.doc: Additional custom fields submitted with the booking form.

members.name: bookedEntity
members.doc: An object describing the slot or schedule that was booked.

members.name: bookingSource
members.doc: An object describing the platform and application that made the booking. Read-Only.

members.name: contactDetails
members.doc: Contact details of the site visitor or member making the booking.

members.name: createdBy
members.doc:
id of the identity used to create the booking
If both Person identity and App identity are present, person identity takes precedence
only `id` is supported. contact_id and identity_type are not supported

members.name: doubleBooked
members.doc: Indicating if this booking overlaps an other existing confirmed booking

members.name: endDate
members.doc: The end date of this booking. For a slot, this is the end date of the slot. For a schedule, the end date of the last session.

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc: data extensions ExtendedFields

members.name: externalUserId
members.doc: External ID provided by the client app on creation. Read-Only.

members.name: numberOfParticipants
members.doc: Number of participants

members.name: paymentStatus
members.doc:
Payment status.
One of:
- `"NOT_PAID"` The booking is not paid for.
- `"PAID"` The booking is fully paid.
- `"PARTIALLY_PAID"` The booking is partially paid.
- `"REFUNDED"` The booking is refunded.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Revision number to be used when updating, rescheduling, or cancelling the booking. The revision number is automatically incremented when the booing is updated.

members.name: selectedPaymentOption
members.doc:
Selected payment option.
One of the payment options offered by the service, or another option if `skipSelectedPaymentOptionValidation` is `true`.
When undefined, the payment option is resolved by the service configuration on checkout. See [Create Booking](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/bookings-gateway/create-booking)

members.name: startDate
members.doc: The start date of this booking. For a slot, this is the start date of the slot. For a schedule, the start date of the first session.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Booking status.
One of:
- `"CREATED"` - The booking was created.
- `"UPDATED"` - The booking was updated.
- `"CONFIRMED"` - The booking has been confirmed and appears on the bookings calendar.
Booking can be manually confirmed using the Set As Confirmed endpoint.
Booking can be automatically confirmed when the following requirements are met:
+ The service is configured as automatically confirmed.
+ Invoking eCommerce checkout API and an order has been created.
- `"CANCELED"` - The booking has been canceled and synced to bookings calendar.
The booking can be canceled using cancel API.
- `"PENDING"` - The booking waiting to be confirmed or declined buy the owner and is synced to bookings calendar.
Bookings can be manually set as pending using setAsPending API, requires manage booking status permissions.
Booking can be automatically set as pending when the following requirements are met:
+ The Service is configured as manually confirmed.
+ Invoking the eCommerce checkout API and an order has been created.
- `"WAITING_LIST"` - The booking is pending on a waiting list.
Booking can be created with this status when invoking waiting list join API.
- `"DECLINED"` - The booking was declined by the owner and synced to bookings calendar.
Booking can be manually declined using decline API and requires manage booking permissions.
Booking can be automatically declined when the following requirements are met:
+ Invoking eCommerce checkout API and the order declined event has been sent.
+ Invoking eCommerce checkout API and order approved event has been sent, but the booking is offline and the booking causes a double booking.

description:
The fieldMask should not include both the "numberOfParticipants" and "participantsInfo" paths, doing so will result
in an error. "participantsInfo" should be preferred over "numberOfParticipants"

members.name: _id
members.doc: entity_id

members.name: namespaceData
members.doc: only data from UpdateExtendedFieldsRequest namespace_data

members.name: numberOfParticipants
members.doc: Updated number of participants.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the current revision must be passed when
managing the booking.

members.name: bookingId
members.doc: ID of the booking to update the number of participants for.

members.name: numberOfParticipants
members.doc: Updated number of participants.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the current revision must be passed when
managing the booking.

members.name: booking
members.doc: Booking with updated number of participants.

members.name: bookingId
members.doc: ID of the booking to cancel.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc:
Information about whether to notify the customer about the cancelation and
the message to send.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes,
the current revision must be passed when managing the booking.

members.name: ignoreCancellationPolicy
members.doc:
Whether the cancelation policy applies when canceling the booking. When
passing `false` you can only cancel a booking if the cancelation policy
allows it. Your app must have the `BOOKINGS.IGNORE_BOOKING_POLICY `
permission scope when passing `true`.

Default: `false`.

<!--ONLY:VELO
Requires "Manage Wix Bookings App" and "Manage Bookings' Calendar" [roles](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-overview#bookings-admin).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: withRefund
members.doc:
Whether to issue a refund when canceling the booking.
The refund will be issued only if the booking is refundable.
Currently, booking is considered refundable when it was paid by membership.
If passing `true`, the booking flow control settings will be set with refund,
otherwise, either if `false` is passed or the field remains empty,
the booking flow control settings will be set with no refund.

Default: `false`.

members.name: booking
members.doc: Canceled booking.

members.name: bookingId
members.doc: ID of the booking to confirm.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc:
Information about whether to notify the customer about the confirmation and
the message to send.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the current revision must be passed when
managing the booking.

members.name: additionalFields
members.doc:
Additional custom fields of the booking form. The customer must provide
information for each field when booking the service. For example, that they
bring their own towels or whether they use a wheelchair.

Max: 100 fields

members.name: bookingSource
members.doc:
Identifies the source (platform, actor and app) that created this booking.
This property of the booking cannot be changed.
The app_def_id and app_name will be resolved automatically.
TODO GAP See if we need this - might be able to get this data from the headers?

members.name: contactDetails
members.doc: Contact details of the customer booking the service.

members.name: externalUserId
members.doc:
A user identifier of an external application user that initiated the book request.
Allows an external application to later identify its own bookings and correlate to its own internal users

members.name: flowControlSettings
members.doc:
Information about whether specific procedures of the standard Wix Bookings
creation flow are changed. For example, whether the availability is
checked before creating the booking or if additional payment options are
accepted.

members.name: internalBusinessNote
members.doc:
Internal business note. Not visible to the customer.

Max: 200 characters

members.name: numberOfParticipants
members.doc:
Total number of participants. Available only when the service doesn't have
[variants](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/service-options-and-variants/introduction).

Max: `20`

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Information about a message to send to the customer.

members.name: schedule
members.doc: Information about the schedule to create a booking for.

members.name: selectedPaymentOption
members.doc:
Payment option the customer intends to use.
Must be one of the payment options defined for the service, unless
you pass `flowControlSettings.skipSelectedPaymentOptionValidation` as `true`.

members.name: sendSmsReminder
members.doc:
Whether to send an SMS reminder to the customer 24 hours before the
session starts. The phone number is taken from `contactDetails.phone`.

Default: `true`.

members.name: slot
members.doc:
Information about the slot to create a booking for.
If you set `slot.location.locationType` to `CUSTOM`, the created slot's
location is set to `slot.location.formattedAddress` when provided.
Otherwise it's set to `contactDetails.fullAddress.formattedAddress`.

members.name: schedule
members.doc: Information about the schedule to create a booking for.

members.name: slot
members.doc:
Information about the slot to create a booking for.
If you set `slot.location.locationType` to `CUSTOM`, the created slot's
location is set to `slot.location.formattedAddress` when provided.
Otherwise it's set to `contactDetails.fullAddress.formattedAddress`.

members.name: skipAvailabilityValidation
members.doc:
Whether the availability is checked before creating the booking. When
passing `false` a booking is only created when the slot or schedule is
available. Your app must have the `BOOKINGS.OVERRIDE_AVAILABILITY`
permission scope when passing `true`.

Default: `false`.

members.name: skipBusinessConfirmation
members.doc:
Whether `PENDING` bookings are automatically set to `CONFIRMED` for
services that normally require the owner's manual confirmation. Your
app must have the `BOOKINGS.OVERRIDE_AVAILABILITY` permission scope
when passing `true`.

Default: `false`.

members.name: skipSelectedPaymentOptionValidation
members.doc:
Whether customers can pay using a payment method that isn't supported
for the service, but that's supported for other services. Your app
must have the `BOOKINGS.MANAGE_PAYMENTS` permission scope when passing
`true`.

Default: `false`.

members.name: booking
members.doc: Created booking.

members.name: bookingId
members.doc: ID of the booking to decline.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc:
Information about whether to notify the customer about the decline and
the message to send.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the current revision must be passed when
managing the booking.

members.name: booking
members.doc: Declined booking.

members.name: bookingId
members.doc: Id of the booking to reschedule.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc:
Information about whether to notify the customer about the rescheduling and
the message to send.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the current revision must be passed when
managing the booking.

members.name: slot
members.doc: Information about the new slot.

members.name: ignoreReschedulePolicy
members.doc:
Whether the rescheduling policy applies when rescheduling the booking.
When passing `false` you can only cancel a booking if the rescheduling
policy allows it. Your app must have the `BOOKINGS.IGNORE_BOOKING_POLICY `
permission scope when passing `true`.

Default: `false`.

<!--ONLY:VELO
Requires "Manage Wix Bookings App" and "Manage Bookings' Calendar" [roles](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-overview#bookings-admin).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: skipAvailabilityValidation
members.doc:
Whether the availability is checked before rescheduling the booking.
When passing `false` a booking is only created when the slot or
schedule is available. Your app must have the `BOOKINGS.OVERRIDE_AVAILABILITY`
permission scope when passing `true`.

Default: `false`.

members.name: skipBusinessConfirmation
members.doc:
Whether the rescheduled booking's status is automatically set to
`CONFIRMED` for services that normally require the owner's manual
confirmation. Your app must have the `BOOKINGS.OVERRIDE_AVAILABILITY`
permission scope when passing `true`.

Default: `false`.

members.name: booking
members.doc: Rescheduled booking.

members.name: endDate
members.doc: The end time of this Slot (formatted according to RFC3339). Required.

members.name: location
members.doc: Geographic location of the slot.

members.name: resource
members.doc: The resource required for this slot. Currently, in Bookings, this is the relevant staff. Required.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule identifier. Required.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: Service identifier. Required.

members.name: sessionId
members.doc: Identifier for underlying session when session is a single session or generated from a recurring session. Required.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: The start time of this Slot (formatted according to RFC3339). Required.

members.name: timezone
members.doc: The timezone according to which the slot is calculated presented.

members.name: bookingId
members.doc: ID of the booking to update the number of participants for.

members.name: numberOfParticipants
members.doc: Updated number of participants.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the booking is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the current revision must be passed when
managing the booking.

members.name: booking
members.doc: Booking with updated number of participants.

members.name: totalSpots
members.doc:
Total number of spots and open spots for this waiting list.
For example, a Yoga class of 10 waiting list spots with 3 registered on the waiting list  has total_spots: 10 and open_spots: 7.
